Apple - Apple Scab.description: Apple scab is a fungal disease caused by Venturia inaequalis. It causes dark, scabby lesions on leaves, fruit, and sometimes young twigs.
Apple - Apple Scab.treatment: Apply fungicides early in the season. Remove and destroy infected leaves and debris. Use resistant apple varieties.

Apple - Black Rot.description: Black rot is a fungal disease that affects apple trees, causing fruit rot, leaf spot, and cankers on branches.
Apple - Black Rot.treatment: Prune infected branches, remove mummified fruit, and apply fungicides in early spring.

Apple - Cedar Apple Rust.description: A fungal disease requiring two hosts: apples and junipers. Causes yellow-orange spots on apple leaves.
Apple - Cedar Apple Rust.treatment: Remove nearby junipers, apply fungicides during early leaf development, and use resistant varieties.

Apple - Healthy.description: The apple plant appears healthy with no visible signs of disease or stress.
Apple - Healthy.treatment: Continue good horticultural practices like proper watering, pruning, and fertilization.

Blueberry - Healthy.description: The blueberry plant is in good health with no visible symptoms of disease.
Blueberry - Healthy.treatment: Maintain healthy soil pH and provide consistent irrigation and mulch.

Cherry - Powdery Mildew.description: Powdery mildew on cherry trees presents as a white, powdery fungal growth on leaves and shoots.
Cherry - Powdery Mildew.treatment: Prune for air circulation and apply sulfur-based fungicides early in the season.

Cherry - Healthy.description: Cherry plant is healthy with normal leaf and fruit development.
Cherry - Healthy.treatment: Maintain regular care, watering, and monitor for any early disease signs.

Corn - Cercospora Leaf Spot (Gray Leaf S.description: Caused by the fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis, it appears as rectangular gray lesions on corn leaves.
Corn - Cercospora Leaf Spot (Gray Leaf S.treatment: Use resistant hybrids, practice crop rotation, and apply fungicides during tasseling.

Corn - Common Rust.description: Common rust causes small, round, cinnamon-brown pustules on corn leaves.
Corn - Common Rust.treatment: Plant resistant varieties and apply fungicides if rust pressure is high.

Corn - Northern Leaf Blight.description: A fungal disease forming long, elliptical gray-green lesions on corn leaves.
Corn - Northern Leaf Blight.treatment: Use resistant hybrids and apply fungicides at early tassel stage if needed.

Corn - Healthy.description: Corn plant is growing normally with no visible diseases.
Corn - Healthy.treatment: Ensure adequate nutrients, monitor for pests and follow good agronomic practices.

Grape - Black Rot.description: Black rot causes brown leaf spots and shriveled black fruit, reducing grape yield.
Grape - Black Rot.treatment: Remove mummified grapes, apply fungicides, and prune for air circulation.

Grape - Esca (Black Measles).description: Esca causes black streaking in wood and tiger-stripe leaf symptoms, leading to vine decline.
Grape - Esca (Black Measles).treatment: Remove infected vines, avoid pruning in wet conditions, and disinfect tools.

Grape - Leaf Blight (Isariopsis Leaf Spo.description: This fungal disease causes angular brown spots on grape leaves with yellow halos.
Grape - Leaf Blight (Isariopsis Leaf Spo.treatment: Improve air circulation and apply protective fungicides.

Grape - Healthy.description: The grapevine appears healthy with lush foliage and no signs of disease.
Grape - Healthy.treatment: Continue regular care including pruning, trellising, and disease monitoring.

Orange - Haunglongbing (Citrus Greening).description: HLB is a bacterial disease spread by psyllids that causes yellow shoots, lopsided fruit, and dieback.
Orange - Haunglongbing (Citrus Greening).treatment: Control psyllid populations, remove infected trees, and follow regional management programs.

Peach - Bacterial Spot.description: Causes dark, sunken spots on fruit and leaves, often leading to premature fruit drop.
Peach - Bacterial Spot.treatment: Apply copper sprays during dormant season and remove infected leaves or fruits.

Peach - Healthy.description: The peach tree is healthy and productive with no current disease symptoms.
Peach - Healthy.treatment: Maintain proper irrigation, fertilization, and monitor for pests.

Pepper, Bell - Bacterial Spot.description: Small, water-soaked lesions appear on pepper leaves and fruit, turning brown and sunken.
Pepper, Bell - Bacterial Spot.treatment: Use certified seeds, apply copper-based fungicides, and rotate crops.

Pepper, Bell - Healthy.description: Bell pepper plant is healthy with vigorous growth and green foliage.
Pepper, Bell - Healthy.treatment: Continue with proper nutrient and pest management.

Potato - Early Blight.description: Early blight causes dark concentric rings on older leaves, reducing yield.
Potato - Early Blight.treatment: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil and practice crop rotation.

Potato - Late Blight.description: A serious disease caused by Phytophthora infestans leading to black lesions on leaves and tubers.
Potato - Late Blight.treatment: Use certified seed, apply systemic fungicides, and destroy infected plants.

Potato - Healthy.description: Potato plant shows no symptoms and has healthy foliage.
Potato - Healthy.treatment: Maintain soil health and ensure proper irrigation and hilling.

Raspberry - Healthy.description: Raspberry bush is growing normally with no signs of disease or stress.
Raspberry - Healthy.treatment: Prune regularly and provide adequate nutrients and support structures.

Soybean - Healthy.description: Soybean plants are thriving and disease-free.
Soybean - Healthy.treatment: Maintain weed control, irrigation, and scout fields regularly.

Squash - Powdery Mildew.description: Fungal disease forming white powdery growth on leaves, reducing photosynthesis.
Squash - Powdery Mildew.treatment: Apply sulfur-based or neem oil fungicides and improve airflow.

Strawberry - Leaf Scorch.description: Causes small purple spots on leaves that dry and curl, often under humid conditions.
Strawberry - Leaf Scorch.treatment: Remove infected leaves and apply appropriate fungicides during flowering.

Strawberry - Healthy.description: Strawberry plants appear vigorous with no apparent disease signs.
Strawberry - Healthy.treatment: Fertilize properly and ensure good drainage to avoid root diseases.

Tomato - Bacterial Spot.description: Leads to black specks on leaves and fruit, affecting market quality.
Tomato - Bacterial Spot.treatment: Use disease-free seeds, copper sprays, and avoid overhead watering.

Tomato - Early Blight.description: Presents as concentric brown rings on lower leaves and can defoliate the plant.
Tomato - Early Blight.treatment: Use fungicides like mancozeb, prune lower leaves, and rotate crops.

Tomato - Late Blight.description: Highly destructive disease causing water-soaked spots that become dark and moldy.
Tomato - Late Blight.treatment: Destroy infected plants, avoid overhead watering, and apply systemic fungicides.

Tomato - Leaf Mold.description: Yellow patches on top of leaves and olive-green mold underneath, often in humid conditions.
Tomato - Leaf Mold.treatment: Improve ventilation, use resistant varieties, and apply fungicides.

Tomato - Septoria Leaf Spot.description: Causes small circular leaf spots with dark borders and pale centers.
Tomato - Septoria Leaf Spot.treatment: Remove infected leaves, improve airflow, and use fungicides.

Tomato - Spider Mites (Two-Spotted Spide.description: Tiny mites that cause stippling and webbing on leaves, leading to leaf drop.
Tomato - Spider Mites (Two-Spotted Spide.treatment: Use miticides or insecticidal soap and increase humidity.

Tomato - Target Spot.description: Spots resemble targets with concentric rings, often on older leaves.
Tomato - Target Spot.treatment: Remove affected foliage and apply contact fungicides.

Tomato - Yellow Leaf Curl Virus.description: Transmitted by whiteflies, this virus causes leaf curling, yellowing, and stunted growth.
Tomato - Yellow Leaf Curl Virus.treatment: Control whiteflies, use resistant seeds, and remove infected plants.

Tomato - Mosaic Virus.description: Leaves show a mottled green-yellow pattern and may become distorted.
Tomato - Mosaic Virus.treatment: Remove infected plants and avoid tobacco products near crops.

Tomato - Healthy.description: Tomato plant is thriving with green, disease-free leaves.
Tomato - Healthy.treatment: Maintain soil fertility, avoid overwatering, and inspect for early signs of pests.
